meanings.definition: A rancher or farmer in Spanish-speaking countries.
meanings.sent1: The rancheros worked hard to take care of the animals on the farm.
meanings.sent2: The rancheros owned a large piece of land where they raised cattle.
meanings.sent3: The rancheros joked that the cows were better at waking up early than they were.
meanings.sent4: The rancheros were the guardians of the vast fields, protecting them from harm.
meanings.sent5: The rancheros wore wide-brimmed hats and sturdy boots as they tended to their crops.

meanings.definition: A Mexican dish consisting of eggs, tortillas, and salsa.
meanings.sent1: For breakfast, Maria enjoyed a plate of delicious rancheros with a side of beans.
meanings.sent2: The restaurant's specialty was huevos rancheros, a flavorful and filling meal.
meanings.sent3: The rancheros at the diner were so tasty that they made everyone's mouth water.
meanings.sent4: The aroma of the sizzling rancheros filled the kitchen, making everyone hungry.
meanings.sent5: The chef added a unique twist to the classic rancheros, making them a customer favorite.

meanings.definition: A style of Mexican folk music.
meanings.sent1: The lively rancheros music had everyone clapping and dancing along.
meanings.sent2: The band played traditional rancheros songs that celebrated Mexican culture.
meanings.sent3: The rancheros music was so catchy that it stayed in your head all day.
meanings.sent4: The festive rancheros melodies filled the town square with joy and laughter.
meanings.sent5: The rhythmic beat of the rancheros music made it impossible not to tap your feet.
